Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_n0g1mfvZGg1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/SaPNp8RfvvE" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p>Much like <em><strong>KSP</strong></em> itself, <strong>dtobi</strong>'s <a href="http://bit.ly/1fUxkPf"><strong>CoolRockets</strong></a> is in early access and has gotten great word of mouth. With a nod to the ever popular <strong>HotRockets</strong>, <strong>CoolRockets</strong> acts as a series of “cool” visual enhancements for stock engines and tanks. It adds effects such as cryogenic engine boil-off and falling ice chunks to the usual effects you know and love.</p>

<p><strong>dtobi</strong> is looking for feedback on <strong>CoolRockets</strong>, so make sure to click on this <a href="http://bit.ly/1fUxkPf"><strong>LINK</strong></a> and tell <strong>dtobi</strong> what you think.</p>

[]

Edited August 2, 2019 by CvVtjRtb

WarmRockets anyone?

What would that do? Better Emissives? I admit, they could be improved on in some areas.

What would that do? Better Emissives? I admit, they could be improved on in some areas.

Emmesives? Isn't that already done by HotRockets?

Emmesives? Isn't that already done by HotRockets?

No, emissives are what happens when the engine nozzle starts to glow. HotRockets changes the exhaust.
Great visual effects! The boil-off seems a bit too big for those engines, but other than that, it's pretty cool (pun, sorry ).

You should do dtobi's shuttle engine mod next!

It makes building and flying shuttles a breeze, as well as adding a whole bunch of extra tidbits for making cool contraptions, like auto stagers, action group timers (hit action group 1, timer counts down 10 seconds, then activates action group 1), as well as a host of other things. It is just as good as his other mods, and definitely deserves a mod spotlight.
